'Arachidonic acid' (AA, sometimes ARA) is a polyunsaturated omega-6 fatty acid
20:4(Ï-6). It is the counterpart to the saturated arachidic acid found in peanut
oil, (L. arachis – peanut.) {{cite web| title = Dorland's
Medical Dictionary – 'A'
   | url= http://www.mercksource.com/pp/us/cns/cns_hl_dorlands.jspzQzpgzEzzSzpp-

headings: Health effects of arachidonic acid supplementation
